title: Verify NFT authenticity [NFT-MAKER]
description: Authenticity is a big problem in the NFT space. Art gets stolen, buyers get scammed & artists have a hard time verifying their art.

f6_assessments.q0:
The challenge is asking for a way to drive mass-scale adoption of DID usage as an easy-to-use onramp to the Cardano ecosystem.
The problem statement should more closely align with the challenge however the solution is clear and reasonable.
The goal of using artists DIDs to verify authentic NFTs aligns with the challenge objective.
The solution may able to scale to drawing in millions of DID users but the proposal does not define the size of the target market or a market plan for growth. How effective it would be at driving mass-scale is hard to assess without more info.
Based upon my experience, I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has not provided sufficient evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal in the form of references or links. The proposer's role with NFT-Maker is not obvious despite the website link.
The team has not been sufficiently identified in terms of skills and number required to implement the proposal.
The budget may be reasonable to achieve the goals however it is a large lump sum that is not broken down into identifiable items so there is no way to assess.
The timetable may be realistic to complete the work however it is long compared to other proposals of similar scope and does not show what is being done and when.
The plan does not describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal however given the scope there may be none.
The proposal does not identify risks and challenges to a successful implementation.
Based upon my experience, I neither agree nor disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal does not provide a roadmap with auditable milestones and a defined timeline.
The proposal should include projected metrics that correspond to the challenge objective such as the number of DID users projected to be onboarded at specific time intervals and the recruitment cost per DID user. Upon implementation, the number of DID users projected would be 0 however the proposal should project out to a timeline in which the community could expect DID users to be recruited assuming future funding. When could the community expect the challenge objectives to be measurably met if this project were funded? 
The proposal should detail specifically how progress will be reported back to the Catalyst community at regular intervals.
Based upon my experience, I strongly disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: NFTs are a hot item and a gateway to the crypto universe at the moment. Creating DIDs to further cement NFT authenticity would created a benefit for users on both sides, and be something requested by the artist as well as the collectors.
f6_assessments.q1: They are behind well-known successfull cardano NFT projects with proven success. They do not go too much into detail with how this will be implemented and developed, but their are already directly involved in the NFT space.
f6_assessments.q2: They don't leave a gameplan for success besides whether or not they are able to make the final implementation for the users and artists. We won't be able to measure progress, only a yay or nay on the success and implementation.

solution: By using Atala Prism on the NFT-MAKER marketplace we want to make it easier for artists to verify the authenticity of their art.
experience:
Our team is behind NFT-MAKER and NFT-MAKER PRO - the two most used NFT creation tools on Cardano.

In the space since 2017.
